column2: Hey!! We are so in luck! Treeger said that we\ncould have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there. (Goes back into the\nhall)'
Oh no-no-no, I\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m paddling away!'
(Returning carrying a couple of rusted lawn chairs) Huh?!'
Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!'
Uh-huh. This and a bunch of bubble wrap. And,\nsome of it is not even popped! '
Could we be more white trash?'
(Entering from her bedroom) How desperate am I?'
Oh! Good thing Chandler\xc2\x92s not here, he always wins at\nthis game.'
I just told my Mom I\xc2\x92d cater a party for her.'
How come?'
Because I need the money, and I thought that it\xc2\x92d be a\ngreat way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.'
Come on, I think this is a good thing. I don\xc2\x92t think Mom\nwould\xc2\x92ve hired you if she didn\xc2\x92t think you were good at what you do.'
You don\xc2\x92t have to stick up for her. She can\xc2\x92t here\nyou.'
(entering) Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?'
Just pickle.'
Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the\nstreet yesterday.'
My boss, Joanna? Wow, that must\xc2\x92ve been awkward.'
Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a\ndrink.'
(laughs) You ah, you didn\xc2\x92t say \xc2\x91Yes\xc2\x92 to that\ndid you?'
(laughs) No. No!'
(Coming out of the shower wearing nothing but a towel) Hello,\nRachel. (She goes into Chandler\xc2\x92s bedroom)'
Well, not at first.'
What is she doing here?'
I don\xc2\x92t understand! Last time you went out with her you\nsaid she was a \xc2\x91big, dull dud.\xc2\x92'
Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we\nwere able to take the relationship to the next level.'
Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must\nend it now!'
Oh, come on! It\xc2\x92s not like this is an everyday\noccurrence for me! I mean usually I\xc2\x92m pretty much just in there by myself.'
Chandler!! (He turns around quickly) Promise me, you will end\nit.'
Okay, I promise, I\xc2\x92ll end it.'
Thank you.'
I hope you know what I\xc2\x92m giving up for ya, because\nshe\xc2\x92s not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.'
Yeah-eh-eah! (Rachel glares at him) Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what\nhe meant.'
(entering) How\xc2\x92s the hired help?'
Doing great, the quiches are coming along.'
What\xc2\x92s this? Blue nail polish?'
Yeah, I thought it was cute.'
Ahh, that\xc2\x92s what your Grandmother\xc2\x92s hands\nlooked like when we found her.'
Let me ask you a question.'
Hmm.'
Why did you hire me?'

Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of
course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very
nice, I assume you weren\xc2\x92t sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would
be something. (Leaves)'
(to Phoebe) Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because\nshe thinks I\xc2\x92m good.'
Okay, I didn\xc2\x92t hear that.'
Oh yeah, she didn\xc2\x92t hire me out of pity, it wasn\xc2\x92t\nso she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks I\xc2\x92m good.'
Wow! And hey, it\xc2\x92s cool if you\xc2\x92re a lesbian! (Gives\nher a thumbs up)'
(Entering before Joey can say anything) Good afternoon,\nare you the decision maker of the house?'
Uhhhh. (He\xc2\x92s not sure)'
Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopedias? '
No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in\nthere.'

Actually, I\xc2\x92m not buying. I\xc2\x92m selling. Let me\nask you one question. Do your friends ever have a conversation and you just nod along even\nthough you\xc2\x92re not really sure what they\xc2\x92re talking about?'
\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92m telling you it\xc2\x92s totally unconstituional.'
Oh yeah, I totally agree.'
\xc2\x85I think he deserves a Nobel Prize. (Joey starts to nod\n\xc2\x91Yes.\xc2\x92)'
Nooo!! (Joey quickly stops nodding his head.)'
\xc2\x85it was like the Algonquin kids table. (They all laugh,\nbut Joey only laughs not to be left out.)'
(Interrupting the flashback) Excuse me, I\xc2\x92m sorry,\nyou haven\xc2\x92t said anything for about two and a half minutes, are you at all\ninterested?'
Yeah-well-yeah! Yeah-oh-yeah. Come on in.'
That\xc2\x92s weird.'
What?'
Your nails.'
Oh, I know, I never wear fake ones. I just did it so my Mom\nwouldn\xc2\x92t give me grief about me biting them.'
Oh, no, I meant that it\xc2\x92s weird that you only have nine\nnow.'
(Looks at her nails) Oh my God. Wait a minute, I had them\nput\xc2\x85 (realises) Oh my God! It\xc2\x92s in the quiche! Oh My God!'

Okay, don\xc2\x92t panic. I\xc2\x92m gonna go to the store,
I\xc2\x92m gonna get you another set of nails, no one\xc2\x92s gonna know, and you\xc2\x92re
gonna look great. (She runs over to get her coat.) Oh! Oh, it\xc2\x92s \xc2\x91cause
they\xc2\x92re gonna eat\xc2\x97that\xc2\x92s the problem.'
(entering) (to Monica) Honey, don\xc2\x92t bite your nails.'
Okay ah, please don\xc2\x92t freak out. Umm, but ah,\nthere\xc2\x92s a blue fingernail in one of the quiche cups, and there\xc2\x92s no way to know\nwhich one.'
And! Whoever finds it wins the prize!'
(laughs) I\xc2\x92m not freaking out.'
Then why are you laughing?'
It\xc2\x92s nothing, it\xc2\x92s just that now your Father\nowes me five dollars.'
What? You bet I\xc2\x92d lose a nail?'
Oh no, don\xc2\x92t be silly. I just bet I\xc2\x92d need\nthese. (Opens the freezer to reveal\xc2\x85)'
Frozen lasagnas?'
Um-hmm.'
You bet that I\xc2\x92d screw up?! So all that stuff about\nhiring me because I was good was\xc2\x85'
No-no-no, that was all true. This was just in case you\npulled a Monica.'
You promised Dr. Weinburg, you\xc2\x92d never use that phrase.'
Oh honey, come on, have a sense of humour, you\xc2\x92ve\nnever been able to laugh at yourself.'
(laughs) That\xc2\x92s right. My Mom doesn\xc2\x92t have any faith\nin me! Oh, that\xc2\x92s hilarious! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha.'
I don\xc2\x92t get it.'
No, I have faith\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) No! You have lasagnas! (Storms out and an\nawkward silence follows.)'
Ding!'
Op, the ruined quiches are ready.'
It just doesn\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85feel like we\xc2\x92re breaking up.'
No, we are. I\xc2\x92m sad.'
Okay.'
(answering the phone) Yes. (listens) Uh, can\xc2\x92t you wait\nuntil tomorrow? (listens) All right. (hangs up) Unbelievable!!'
Thanks.'
No, no, that was my boss. I have to go.'
Okay. (Starts to button up his shirt)'
What are you doing?'
I\xc2\x92m getting dressed.'
Why?'
When I walk outside naked people throw garbage at me.'
Wait. I wanna show you something.'
What is it?'
Just a little gag gift somebody gave me. (She\xc2\x92s holding a\npair of handcuffs) Put your hands together.'
Ah-ha, you\xc2\x92re not the boss of me. (She kisses him)\nYeah, you are! (She handcuffs him to the chair) Ooh, saucy.'
(kisses him) I\xc2\x92ll be back in ten minutes. (Starts to\nleave)'
You are, you\xc2\x92re gonna leave me like this?'
Knowing you\xc2\x92re here, waiting for me I think it\xc2\x92s\nkinda exciting.'
Okay. But if you don\xc2\x92t come back soon, (She leaves and\ncloses the door) there\xc2\x92s pretty much nothing I can do about it!'
(locking her door) Oh.'
Hi! I brought you back a macaroon!'
Oh great! I\xc2\x92ll keep it in my butt with your nose. (She\ngrabs the cookie and walks out.)'
That\xc2\x92s weird, she locked the door.'
Y\xc2\x92know why? She\xc2\x92s got the Christmas bonus list in\nthere. I saw her working on it this morning.'
Okay, swear you won\xc2\x92t tell, but when Mark left he gave me\na key to Joanna\xc2\x92s office. Do you wanna see the list?'
Yeah!'
Hi! (to Sophie) How are you?'
Hello, Joanna\xc2\x85(Realises he doesn\xc2\x92t know her last\nname)\xc2\x85\xc2\x92s office.'
(on speaker phone) I\xc2\x92m really sorry but I may be a little\nwhile longer.'
How little?!'
A couple of hours, I feel awful.'
Look, this isn\xc2\x92t funny! You get back here right now!'
I can\xc2\x92t!!'
Why not?!'
I\xc2\x92m in my boss\xc2\x92s car!'
What?!'
Uh-oh, tunnel. (The phone gets cut off)'
(answering it) (angrily) What?!'
(in a serious, businesslike tone) Rachel, could I see you\nfor a moment?'

Okay, here\xc2\x92s the situation. The keys to the cuffs are\non the back of the door. Could you be a doll and grab them and scoot on over and unlock\nme? And on a totally different subject, that is a lovely pantsuit.'
You promised you would break up with her!'
I did break up with her! She just took it really, really\nwell!'
And the fact that you were jeopardising my career never\nentered your mind?!'
It did enter my mind! But then something happened that made\nit, shoot right out.'
Y'know what Chandler, you got yourself into those cuffs, you\nget yourself out of them."

No-no-no-no-no-no-no!! I can\xc2\x92t get myself right out of
them! You must have me confused with the Amazing Chandler!! Come on, you have to unlock
me, she could be gone for hours, and I\xc2\x92m cold, and (Stops and looks up the skirt on a
statue behind Joanna\xc2\x92s desk.)'
Oh, Chandler!! All right, this is it! (Grabs the key) You\nnever see Joanna again!'
Never!'
You never come into this office again!'
Fine!'
You give me back my Walkman!'
I\xc2\x97never borrowed your Walkman.'
Well, then I lost it. You buy me one!'
You got it! Here we go! Come on! This is great! (Rachel goes\nover and unlocks the handcuffs) Ahhh! (He starts rubbing his wrist)'
Does it hurt?'
No, I just always see guys doing this when they get\nhandcuffs taken off them. (He runs over to where his pants are hanging) Hello sweet pants!'
Wait a minute! What are you gonna tell Joanna?'
About what?'
When she sees that you\xc2\x92re gone, she\xc2\x92s gonna know\nthat I let you out, and that I was in here, and I\xc2\x92m gonna get fired!'
I\xc2\x92ll make something up! I\xc2\x92m good at lying, I\nactually did borrow your Walkman!'

No, there\xc2\x92s nothing to make up, she\xc2\x92s gonna know\nthat I have a key to her office, I\xc2\x92ve got to get you locked up back the way you were!\n(She tries to drag him over to the chair, but Chandler stops her.)'
Oh-ho-ho, I don\xc2\x92t think so!'
Well, this is much better.'
So, here\xc2\x92s somebody interesting, Joey. What do you\nknow about Van Gogh?'
He cut off his ear.'
And?'
I\xc2\x92m out.'
He painted that. (Points to one of his paintings in the\nbook)'
Wow! That\xc2\x92s pretty nice. I thought he cut off his ear\n\xc2\x91cause he sucked. What else you got in there?'
Let\xc2\x92s see, ahhh\xc2\x85 Where does the Pope live?'
In the woods. No wait-wait, that\xc2\x92s the joke answer.'
Actually its, Vatican City. Now ahh, what do you know\nabout vulcanised rubber?'
Spock\xc2\x92s birth control.'
(laughs) You need these books.'
Hey!'
Hi.'
This used to be your room? (She nods \xc2\x91Yes\xc2\x92) Wow! You\nmust\xc2\x92ve been in really good shape as a kid.'
Ohh, I\xc2\x92m such an idiot. I can\xc2\x92t believe I actually\nthought she could change.'
Well, who cares what your Mom thinks? So you pulled a Monica.'
Oh good, I\xc2\x92m glad that\xc2\x92s catching on.'

No but, why does that have to be a bad thing. Just change what\nit means. Y'know? Go down there and prove your Mother wrong. Finish the job you were hired\nto do, and we\xc2\x92ll call that pulling a Monica."
What?'

Okay, umm, if a kid gets straight A\xc2\x92s, his parents would
say, "Yeah, he pulled a Monica." Y'know? Or a fireman saves a baby, and they go,
"Yeah I know, he pulled a Monica." Or someone hits a homerun and the announcer
says, "Yeah, that one\xc2\x92s outta here." Though some things don\xc2\x92t change.'
(getting up) All right, I\xc2\x92ll go down there. But, I\xc2\x92m\nnot gonna serve the lasagna. I\xc2\x92m gonna serve something I make.'
Wow! My breasts are really strong. (She goes and joins\nMonica.)'
Chandler! Chandler, please, I have to get you locked up back\nthe way you were, I am sooo gonna lose my job, she\xc2\x92s very private about her office.\nNow I know why.'

Hey, look, you\xc2\x92re in trouble either way! Okay? If she\ncomes back and sees me locked to this instead of the chair, she\xc2\x92s gonna know you were\nin here. So you might as well just let me go.'
What if I clean your bathroom for a month?'
It still wouldn\xc2\x92t be clean. (Rachel makes an \xc2\x91Eww,\ndisgusting!\xc2\x92 face) All I want is my freedom.'
Foot rubs for a month!'
Freedom!'
I\xc2\x92ll take all of your photos and put them into photo\nalbums!'
Freedom! I want my freedom! Why won\xc2\x92t you here me?!\n(Opens the door) Sophie, help me! Help me!! (Sophie stands up)'
Sophie sit!!'
No! God, would you just calm down!'
I\xc2\x92m gonna say this for the last time. Would you please\njust\xc2\x85 (He moves his arm which opens the drawer and hits in the back of the head,\nwhich proves his point.)'
Wow! There\xc2\x92s a lot I didn\xc2\x92t know about vomit. (The\nduck comes to the door of the bathroom, quacking.) (To the duck) In a minute. (The duck\ngoes back into the bathroom.)'
So, what do you say, Joey? You get the whole set of\nencyclopedias for twelve hundred dollars, which works out to just 50 bucks a book!'

Twelve hundred dollars? You think I have $1200? I\xc2\x92m home in\nthe middle of the day, and I got patio furniture in my living room. I guess there\xc2\x92s a\nfew things you don\xc2\x92t get from book learnin\xc2\x92.'
Well ah, what can you swing?'
How about zero down and zero a month for a long, long time?'
You don\xc2\x92t have, anything?'
You wanna see what I got? (He gets up to empty out his pockets)\nOkay? I\xc2\x92ve got a baby Tootsie Roll, a movie stub, keys, a Kleenex, a rock, and an\narmy man. Hey!'
Okay, I-I get the picture. Uh, thanks, for your time.\n(Starts to leave)'
And a 50. (The salesman stops suddenly) Huh, these must be\nChandler\xc2\x92s pants.'
For 50 bucks, you can get one book! What will it be? A?\nB? C?'
Oh, I-I think I\xc2\x92m gonna stick with the V, I wanna see how\nthis bad boy turns out.'
I ah, will buy and wrap all of your Christmas gifts.'
No!'
I ah\xc2\x85 Oh! I\xc2\x92ll squeeze you fresh orange juice every\nmorning!'
With extra pulp?'
(happily) Yeah!!'
No!'
D\xc2\x92oh!! (pause) I\xc2\x92ve got it!'
You don\xc2\x92t have it.'
I have so got it. There\xc2\x92s gonna be\nrumours about this, there\xc2\x92s no way to stop it. Sophie knows, Monica and Phoebe know.'
How do Monica and Phoebe know?'
Oh, I called them. And when they ask me what I saw, I can be\nvery generous (Holds her hands far apart) or very (In a high pitched voice) stingy.'
(intrigued) Go on.'
I can make you a legend. I can make you this generation\xc2\x92s\nMilton Berle.'
And Milton Berle has a\xc2\x85'
Ohh, not compared to you. (Chandler nods in agreement)'
Well?'
They\xc2\x92re not even touching the lasagna!'
Really?!'
Oh, they love your casserole.'
Yes!!'
It\xc2\x92s hard to believe that just a little while ago this\nwas nothing but ingredients.'
(entering) Well, everyone seems to be enjoying your dish.'
And you?'
I thought it was\xc2\x85 quite tasty.'
So if everyone liked it, and you liked it, that would make\nthis a success. Which would make you\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) A bitch?'
Well, I was going for wrong, but we can use your word.'
Yes, well I was wrong, and I have to say you really\nimpressed me today.'
Wow!'
Umm, you might even say that she pulled a Monica. (They both\nlook at her) (to Monica) She doesn\xc2\x92t know we switched it. (Monica nods her head\n\xc2\x91No.\xc2\x92)'
And the next time you cater for me, there will be nothing\nbut ice in the freezer. (She starts to bite her nails)'
That really means a lot. Oh, and Mom, don\xc2\x92t bite your\nnails.'
(hello) Hello.'
Hey!'
(in a sexy voice) Hello, Chandler. (Phoebe has a huge smile on\nher face.)'
(to Rachel) I love you. (Kisses her on the forehead)'
Wh-what\xc2\x92s going on?'
Oh. '
No he doesn\xc2\x92t!'
(checks his watch) Two hours, that lasted!'
So did you break up with Joanna?'
I think so.'
Well, it\xc2\x92s good thing you got out when you did, before she\nblew up like that Vesuvius.'
The volcano?'
Yeah. And speaking of volcanoes, man are they a violent igneous\nrock formation.'
What?!'
Oh yeah, lava spewing, hot ash, of course some are dormant.'
Why are you talking about volcanoes all of the sudden?'
Well, we can talk about something else. What do you want to talk\nabout? Vivisection? The Vasdeferens? The Vietnam War?'
Oh! Did anybody see that-that documentary on the Korean War?\n(Joey is pissed)'
Oh, yeah. Yeah.'
Oh God, Korea is such a beautiful country.'
With such a sad history.'
Could there be more Kims?'
(from her office) Who\xc2\x92s out there?'
It\xc2\x92s me! Good morning!'
Rachel, could you come in here for a moment, please?'
Yeah, sure. Umm, they didn\xc2\x92t have poppy seed bagels, so\nI\xc2\x85 (Enters Joanna\xc2\x92s office and sees her handcuffed to her chair wearing nothing\nbut a slip) Oh my word!'
I seem to have had a slight office mishap. Could you please\nget the key off the back of the door for me.'
Oh, yeah! Yeah!'
You tell your friend Chandler that we\xc2\x92re definately\nbroken up this time.'
Okay.'
